::Fenox::

Fenox jumps in surprise when she feels some wolf teeth on her arm, 
looking back to see tha D was tugging her away from Vlad. She looks 
at Vlad appolegetically.

"Exuse me for a moment, I gotta see what he wants."

Fenox taps a few extra keys, setting up a monitoring system to watch 
Vlad. No acknowledgement came up on the screen for the command. Fenox 
turns and walks off toward the nearest room, walking in and waiting 
for D to enter as well. All the rooms were soundproof, so they could 
talk safely in there.



--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> 
> * D had growled at Vlad all along as he tried to get near to Fenox, 
and was 
> astonished when she began to act towards him with equal enthusiasm.
> What was this?!
> First he's new here and now this male was trying to take Fenox with 
his 
> charme that D could tell was all fake.
> D snapps at Vlads back as he and Fenox walk past him, feeling 
slightly hurt 
> that she had forgotten all about him. But he follows them into the 
ship 
> anyway, not trusting Vlad alone with this woman who was so kind to 
him.
> D peeked over Fenox's shoulder as she activated some computer 
screen, and he 
> had seen many in his life so he knew what they were. Just not how 
to use one 
> very well. That's what the people were trying to teach him before 
they 
> crashed, and he had been doing pretty well.
> There were images of other metal being showing up on the screen as 
D looked, 
> growling at Vlad again and baring his teeth.
> D sat back a bit, looking like a huge wolf statue as his tail 
wrapped around 
> his feet and he hunkered up his shoulders. The fur on the back of 
his neck 
> rising and his eyes glaring at Vlad whenever he decided to look at 
him.
> How could Fenox trust this guy?! Everything about him was wrong!
> But D just sat there for a few more moments before getting up and 
moving his 
> mouth so that he tried to get Fenox's hand in his mouth to lead her 
away 
> from him.
> Vlad was bad news, and he wanted her to be no part of it.*
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>
